elements.title: lose more than half of their lung capacity
elements.contents: ... that many people who recover from tuberculosis lose more than half of their lung capacity (example pictured)?

elements.title: Henry Kailimai
elements.contents: ... that Henry Kailimai and his Hawaiian Quintet were hired by Henry Ford to serve as official musicians for the Ford Motor Company?

elements.title: Edward S. Harkness House
elements.contents: ... that when the Edward S. Harkness House was built, its owner took the address from his neighbor?

elements.title: a New Testament manuscript
elements.contents: ... that a New Testament manuscript was "barbarously scored with red chalk" by a book publisher?

elements.title: Thomas Bertrand-Hudon
elements.contents: ... that Thomas Bertrand-Hudon is the first professional football player to wear a Guardian Cap during a regular season game?

elements.title: CyberJoly Drim
elements.contents: ... that the 1998 cyberpunk short story "CyberJoly Drim" caused a controversy in the Polish science fiction and fantasy community?

elements.title: Ajah Pritchard-Lolo
elements.contents: ... that Ajah Pritchard-Lolo is Vanuatu's first Olympic weightlifter?

elements.title: hapa haole
elements.contents: ... that many hapa haole songs were written by non-Hawaiians and featured nonsensical, faux-Hawaiian lyrics?

elements.title: Shoko Ikeda
elements.contents: ... that Shoko Ikeda once admitted that Haruhi Suzumiya, a character she designed, was "just like me"?
